channel.title: Texting out of country - Cricket Wireless
channel.description:
From:USA To: Luxembourg I've got some shitty ass phone from Cricket. I have the unlimited plan that says it includes out of country texting, it does not say what countries, so I assume it will work for all. How would I go about texting someone from Luxembourg. Their phone numbers are 12 digits long, at least for me here in the USA because you need to dial the country code, then the area code. I believe the phone is in fact a cell phone because [url=http://wwp.greenwichmeantime.com/time-zone/europe/european-union/luxembourg/telephone/]this site[/url] says that the second three digits in my friends number is registered to a cell phone company.
How do I text my friend? It'd be 352 621 XXX XXX - And apparently my phone doesn't like a number that large.. [That's what she said]
-Side Note: I've also got an iPod touch, so if there are any free apps that allow country to country texting, I could use that too.

item.title: Texting out of country - Cricket Wireless
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Kidpaparoach:

Unlim mins is excessive but meh its your money.

Again, I’m only paying $45, not $100.

Mikeyzzz:

Viber, LINE, Kik messenger all these apps are great if you guys can connect through that.

All I’ve got now is my friends phone number. She disconnected her facebook, I was trying to get her to get an app like that

Read full topic

item.title: Texting out of country - Cricket Wireless
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:15, topic:519148”]Who needs unlimited everything? lol

  • theirs websites online which allow you to send small sms texts for free just google it (small messages).[/quote]
    I need unlimited text at minimal. Usually have ~3k in and out in a month. Over 20k total out and 20k in and I’ve had it for less than a year.
    And I’ve had hour long phone calls… More than once a month.

Read full topic

item.title: Texting out of country - Cricket Wireless
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Jmood:

This is what you get when you go with the cheapest option around.

Verizon: Unlimited Talk & Text on a basic phone with 2GB data a month: $90 a phone.
Sprint: Unlimited everything on a basic phone: $99 per.
AT&T: Unlimited Talk & Text, 1000 Out of country minutes ($15), 300MB Data a month: $124.99 (or 125) per. -Basic phone
Cricket: Unlimited Everything on a basic phone: $45 per. -$10 off your bill if you add a line.
Don’t know about you, but I see why it’s a deal

Oh, and AT&T charges $1.99 for a detailed bill…

Read full topic

item.title: Texting out of country - Cricket Wireless
item.dc:creator: @Dustin_Jr Dustin Jr
item.description:
@Dustin_Jr wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:519148”][quote author=Dustin Jr link=topic=637607.msg4297636#msg4297636 date=1368483443]
Why don’t you call cricket and ask them call their customer service, or go to their website and get on live chat or something.
[/quote]
You don’t know cricket then…
I went to their live support to see if you could text/call out of country once a few months ago. The person kept talking about getting me a phone, I said “I just want to know if I can text a person out of country without being fee’d” and they responded something like “Well I can set your new phone up as soon as you pick what one you want”.
They don’t care to help, they care about sales.[/quote]

Get a new carrier then, call again ask to speak to someone else. Call them, dont get on live chat.

Read full topic

They don’t care to help, they care about sales.
